SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Game.Player

Class CardMap

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Server.Model.Game.Player.CardMap
public class CardMap extends Object
This class stores all the information related to the player's placement of cards:
-It stores the Map of placed Cards.
-It stores the available placements for the next round.
-It stores the player's current Resources and Items counters.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CardMap(ObserverRelay gameObserverRelay, String username)
    Default Constructor.
    Builds CardPlacement Object by initializing the two maps and the Array and adds to the Array the first coordinate [0,0] to allow for the starter card to be placed.

      Returns:
      int corresponding to the number of artifacts of type "artifacts" held by the player

    • getCardVisibilityByCoordinate

      public Optional<CardVisibility> getCardVisibilityByCoordinate(Coordinates coordinate)

    • place

      public int place(Card cardToPlace, int coordinateIndex, boolean faceUp) throws CoordinateIndexOutOfBounds
      Method which places the card in cardsPlaced map, updates resources and items of the player, updates covered corners of nearby cards, updates the list of coordinates placed, calls the method to update the available placements and returns the points gained by the player by placing this card. It does not check if the given card can or can't be placed according to the rules, it requires the cards to have been already checked on their constraints.
      Parameters:
      cardToPlace - Card
      coordinateIndex - int
      faceUp - boolean
      Returns:
      Points earned by the player for placing the card.
      Throws:
      CoordinateIndexOutOfBounds

    • getAmountOfNearbyCorners

      public int getAmountOfNearbyCorners(Coordinates coordinates)
      Method to get the amount of corners that would be covered if a card was to be placed at that coordinates. Precondition: All the coordinates passed as parameters of the function are taken from availablePlacements, so we don't need to check if they're legit or not
      Parameters:
      coordinates - Coordinates
      Returns:
      int corresponding to number of corners that would be covered if a card was to be placed at that coordinates

    • getAmountOfPattern

      public int getAmountOfPattern(Map<Coordinates,Artifacts> pattern)
      Calculates the number of times a specific pattern appears on the card map, ensuring that each card is counted only once.
      Parameters:
      pattern - A map representing the pattern to be checked. Each entry in the map consists of a coordinate and an artifact that represent the color of the card that should appear at that coordinate.
      Returns:
      The number of times the pattern appears on the card map, ensuring that each card is counted only once.

    • updateCoveredCornersAndArtifacts

      protected void updateCoveredCornersAndArtifacts(Coordinates placed)
      Method which updates the number of artifacts of the player and the corners that will be covered by the card placed
      Parameters:
      placed - Coordinates

    • updateAvailablePlacements

      protected void updateAvailablePlacements(CardVisibility card, int coordinatesIndex)
      Method used by .place() in this class to update the available placements after adding a card to the cardsPlaced map.
      Parameters:
      card - CardVisibility that was placed using .place() method
      coordinatesIndex - Index of coordinate from availablePlacements used to .place() the card.

    • toTransferableDataObject

      public CardMapRecord toTransferableDataObject()
      Converts the current state of the card map into a CardMapRecord object, which can be transferred over the network. This method iterates through the cards placed on the map, converts each card's visibility into a CardVisibilityRecord, and constructs a map of coordinates to card visibility records. It then creates a new CardMapRecord object containing the card placements, available placements, artifacts counter, and coordinates of placed cards.
      Returns:
      the CardMapRecord representing the current state of the card map for transfer over the network
